Microservices Design Principles

High cohesion

High cohesion means single focus and single responsibility. It follows SOLID principle, which means service only change for one reason.

Autonomous

  • Honor contracts and interfaces

item.title: Xunit Test Patterns
item.description:
Xunit Test Patterns

Published: Aug 27, 2017 Tags: booknotes, architecture Category: ComputerScience

Xunit Test Pattern is a fantastic book which shares the experience and good practice to write tests.

Table of Contents

Test Introduction

Easy to run tests

What makes tests easy to run? Four specific goals answer this question:

  • They must be Fully Automated Tests so they can be run without any effort.
  • They must be Self-Checking Tests so they can detect and report any errors without manual inspection.
  • They must be Repeatable Tests so they can be run multiple times with the same result.
  • Ideally, each test should be an Independent Test that can be run by itself.

Our tests should be small and test one thing at a time.

item.title: Domain Driven Design: Introduction
item.description:
Domain Driven Design: Introduction

Published: Jun 19, 2017 Tags: architecture, process Category: ComputerScience

Domain Driven Design (DDD) is about trying to make your software a model of a real-world system or process. The philosophy of DDD is about placing our attention at the heart of the application, focusing on the complexity that is intrinsic to the business domain itself. In using DDD, you are meant to work closely with a domain expert who can explain how the real-world system works. It also acts as the conceptual foundation for the design of the software itself - how it's broken down into objects or functions. In this blog post, I will cover the key elements of DDD.
